1118611049157099523.text:
This is a kind, friendly but firm reminder to @EFDevcon that this seems like announcement season ;) 
The Golem team can't wait to see where #DEVCON5 will take place at!pic.twitter.com/tibUGNiHhy

1120253448002396161.text: This! we're looking forward to more people developing their own tools with Golem!https://twitter.com/G7685502036/status/1119471561478688768 …

1118119698615369728.text: And one more time: if you want to contribute or discover Graphene for your projects - head over to the website! Https://grapheneproject.io

1118119492637347842.text: As a clarification, @intel is a BIG company (obviously). Graphene’s being led there by the R&D department led by @monavij1 - Edan belongs to a different department working on SGX solutions too!pic.twitter.com/m89Te11Eu4

1118116452119339009.text: Read our Essential Guide to Graphene part I herehttps://blog.golemproject.net/golems-essential-guide-to-graphene/amp/ …

1122844088334782464.text: "But part of building a data commons also means creating common standards for the truth and accuracy of the underlying information." excellent post on data reliability, and why we need Oracle systems by @streamr :)https://twitter.com/streamr/status/1122789803261681664 …

1118908656165314561.text:
The Core Devs Meeting was intense but interesting. Coordination towards #Istambul is getting better.
Noteworthy stuff for Golem in terms of computing in untrusted hosts, wasm, and coordination for dApp developers to know their way around Ethereum! #Fithereum - thanks @bmann!https://twitter.com/fullnode_berlin/status/1118897758444949504 …

1120977919277453312.text:
We loved this article by @Melt_Dem. 
When talking to friends and family, they don't see the problems with data breaches and companies not caring about user privacy.  "I have nothing to hide, so I don't care if they look at my messages" is a usual argumenthttps://medium.com/@Melt_Dem/im-not-an-international-drug-dealer-3e8e3c75c57c …

1118861385390284805.text: Super proud to introduce GolemGrid, the first project to come up from Golem's great community. Phillip has been building it for months now, and after his first alpha, now he's ramped up efforts. He is our first guest writer ever in our blog!https://blog.golemproject.net/introducing-golemgrid-a-community-built-web-gateway-project/ …

1118058966674812930.text: We’re at #RUNEVM: improvements, sidechains, enterprise usage and trusted computing. Ask us all Graphene-related questions, we might know a thing or two about trusted computing :)pic.twitter.com/NxjZDb9eff

1120978493834244096.text: But user and data privacy is so much more than a company checking out your DMs or using your data to sell you products. Have you ever made an online purchase? requested a credit? used online banking? done any kind of KYC? Your whole life in data is out in the open!pic.twitter.com/HU04cPygiV

1117902339673772033.text: Double trouble! If you are in Berlin, Lukasz and @MPtherealMVP will be at #RUNEVM to talk all things Graphene and Golem - it’s not hard to spot them :) - we’ll also stay for the core devs meeting and the @ethereum on Growing Open Source.https://twitter.com/EntEthAlliance/status/1112808484976951296 …

1120255658627149824.text: The latest Week in Ethereum is out, read all about Graphene! Thanks @evan_van_ness once again for summarizing the best this ecosystem has to offer :) https://weekinethereumnews.com/april-19-2019/

1120979110363377664.text:
We need better tools, laws, users need to know their OPSEC well, and read fine-print. Privacy-preserving apps, tools and frameworks are being built but it takes a collective effort to raise awareness! 
Start by helping educate your friends and family :)pic.twitter.com/twHsQXrMti

1118118684453736448.text: Edan introduces the API being specced for usage on EVM and other virtual machines. We see a lot of new potential synergies we could explore here! Thanks #RUNEVM for the invite!pic.twitter.com/08H31roito

1118116262670893056.text: Very exciting to check out Edan Sorski from @intel’s presentation “using the EVM with Trusted Computing at Intel” and happy to be here sharing the community led project Graphene, which supports SGX in the most dev friendly way currently.pic.twitter.com/ml18NFGZhi

1115950766018179072.text:
Today marks the 1-year anniversary of our mainnet launch, what an amazing experience, but the best is yet to come: 
Announcing Graphene - the project built in collaboration with @intel, ITL, and Texas A&M University. Read about it in our blogposts here.https://blog.golemproject.net/graphene-golem-intel-itl-and-founders-of-the-project-establish-a-working-group-towards-cutting-edge-technology-development/ …
